result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Return date on December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Atty Meg OMarro
Second appearance on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Warrant cancelled - Spoke to Sam in Dispatch
Warrant cancelled - Spoke to Sam in Dispatch
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:29 AM Defendant Thomas G Zimdars appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CM33. Defendant states he does not yet have an attorney. Court quashes warrants. Defendant states he is in custody on another case on a cash bond. Court also calls 22CM148, all appearances are the same. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY. ADA makes bond recommendation. Statement by defendant regarding bond. Court sets bond at $500 cash bond  for both cases and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set both cases for Status of Counsel on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:33 AM.
Status hearing on September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely  (emailed to FDL Cty Jail)

(defendant's notice of hearing advising defendant of Return Date on 7/18/2022 has been returned with no forwarding address provided)

Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

9:42 AM Defendant Thomas G Zimdars in court.  Attorney Michael Kapelis in court for Thomas G Zimdars. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and makes a motion to dismiss the complaint due to lack of probable cause. Atty Kapelis states he will be filing a motion to dismiss. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court withholds finding of probable cause until Atty Kapelis files the motion. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Return Date July 18, 2022 at 10:30 AM .

Court adjourned at 9:44 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 12, 2022 at 09:00 am. / Def was mailed a copy of his complaint.

10:01 AM Defendant Thomas G Zimdars appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is unsure if he received the criminal complaint. Court adjourns initial appearance to April 12, 2022 at 9:00 AM. Mandatory appearance. 

Court adjourned at 10:03 AM.

Prior: 200 Merrit Ave, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States

Defendant called Clerk of Courts office and stated his brakes are not working on his vehicle. He was given Zoom telephone instructions. Defendant confirmed address on file is correct, but added Apt. 202. Defendant was informed that he still needs to complete processing.
Notice of Hearing for initial appearance April 5, 2022 at 9:30 AM and criminal complaint were returned. / Return to Sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward.

Warrant letter mailed to the defendant dated March 22, 2022 was returned. / Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as addressed. Unable to Forward.             (NOTE: def's address was previously updated and the warrant was taken care of. Letter was not forwarded.)
Initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am. / Criminal complaint mailed to the def.

Def called regarding his warrant and stated he was not aware he had court on March 22 or that this case even existed. Def stated he never received a summons or a copy of the complaint. Def updated his address and phone number and opted in to receive text message reminders of upcoming court dates. Def was mailed a notice of hearing and a copy of the criminal complaint.
